content: um well
oh dear [Applause]
all right so where do we start here early this summer i got into warhammer
and started building an army i've got a fair bit of terrain on hand
that i've built over the years but only a limited amount of stuff that
really suits 40k obviously my mind quickly wandered to building a
crazy set of terrain to have epic battles on
the thing is i knew i'd want to make a bunch of
really detailed structures and have enough variety to do a lot of different
setups i also wanted enough buildings to be able to do a
really large setup if you know me and my friends could ever get together and do a
huge battle it didn't take me long to realize that scratch building
the amount of stuff that i wanted would be
an insane undertaking especially to get the amount of detail that i actually
wanted on the structures i didn't want just big formless concrete
buildings i thought about doing some sculpting and
molding and casting or maybe doing some stuff with 3d printing
but both of those would still be crazy time investments and really tedious in
the end i decided that i really just wanted the
biggest bang for my buck time-wise this led me to looking into
kits that were readily available on the market and i looked at a lot of
different companies and different kits and options
mdf kits were a strong contender but i knew that they would still be lacking
some of that sculptural detail that i wanted
i really wanted to create this massive industrial
kind of factory wasteland i wanted a death guard inspired set of ruins
eventually i found the rampart system this is by arkon
studios it's literally designed to make big multi-level structures but i
want to make something really clear i didn't choose these sets because they
paid me to do so or to make this video i browsed everything on the market and i
decided that these were the best fit for me and then i reached out to them
and asked them if they wanted to help me do this and they were kind enough to
send me these kits for free but keep in mind
that i likely could have done the same thing with
any company or kits that i felt worked best
these are the ones that i legitimately decided that i would get and use
whether or not they were willing to send them to me but here's the problem with
kits even though it's gonna save me a lot of time
building there's still an insane task of removing
thousands of pieces from plastic sprues before you can even
start to think about assembling i came up with this plan months ago
and have actually been sitting on these kits for the better part of the year
i had planned and carved out some time at the end of the year to dedicate to
this personal project my plan from the start was to include a
bunch of my buddies in the process maybe sit around
drink some beers and tackle this mountain of
prep work but our covet situation has gone completely out of control where i
live in the past month or so and we are in the hardest lockdown yet i
can't safely or legally have any guests in my house
despite this i really needed to get this project
started so i nervously jumped into this daunting task all by
myself i wanted to get as much pre-sniffed as
possible so that when it came time to actually build the structures
i could just really get into it and go wild without interruption
i decided it would be smart to unbox all of the core sets
and organize the sprues into various piles this made me feel
a little less anxious and a bit more in control of what i inherently knew was a
very daunting task and then i got to work
snipping i'm not gonna lie this was really
terrifying at the start i started to panic a little
bit about just how much i had to do thankfully
like with most tasks after i spent a bit of time doing it i
started to find efficiencies and with really repetitive
tasks efficiencies snowball and become very
very important for one doing all of the same sprue in groups meant that i could
quickly learn the most efficient and easy way to remove the various pieces
from that sprue and trust me not all sprues were the
same in this regard some were really fast and some were
painfully slow one great thing that i learned is that
with a lot of the pieces i could simply snap them out of the frame this was
great on the sprues that just had big wall sections but not really useful on
the ones with lots of smaller pieces i know removing
pieces this way is a bit sacrilegious but the reality is that these pieces
would be used to construct big industrial ruins and little nubs of
plastic or broken parts really would not harm the finish of the
outcome in any way and doing this likely increased
my productivity tenfold which was absolutely worth it
not to mention it was just less annoying to do
than using the clippers sure some of the edges would need a nice swipe during
assembly if any large chunks were left on them but the amount of time and
effort this saved versus snipping each tiny contact point can
not be overstated here and as i was doing this i was able to organize the
pieces using the boxes that they came in each box was filled with the same or
similar pieces knowing that the next stage of actually
building would be so fun especially with this organization in place was a huge
motivator for keeping me going all day doing this mind-numbing task by
mid-day i was way farther ahead than i expected and
this gave me a great mental boost to keep powering through what was such a
repetitive and tedious and boring and hand cramping and
just not not a fun task my burst of
excitement and motivation over fast progress was quickly halted
though when i got to one sprue in particular
the one containing the pillars and the little tiny caps for the connection
points there were a lot of these and for the
most part they needed to be snipped they had a lot
of contact points to sniff on each one the stack of these like i think 24
sprues or so took probably the same amount of time as
all of the other sprues which numbered over a hundred
i seriously spent like four hours tackling this one pile
of 24 god forsaken sprues
all right this is where i've ended up after one
day and i've actually got way more accomplished in that day than
i expected i would eight hours straight that's all i did yesterday was sniff
these pieces out actually last night in bed
when i was holding my phone watching something and i was dozing off to sleep
i realized my hand was subconsciously trying to squeeze the
phone like a pair of nippers i really really really wanted to
get all this stuff cut out and get a whole
bunch of stuff actually assembled in one video
that was my goal that's what i wanted to do
and i was well on my way to do it but i realized
late yesterday that these core sets were actually
missing this uh sprues that have the little connection pegs to assemble stuff
these sets can be assembled with magnets if you want
modular sets you can put magnets in all of the holes and just
kind of plug and play and move stuff around i want to build solid structures
and if you do that they come with little plastic pegs you
can use to assemble them and they're missing couldn't i just glue
them together without the pegs technically i probably could
but it would be a much more difficult process the pegs would be really really
useful for holding things together while that glue cures especially because
i want to use plastic cement to get really strong bonds it was going to take
10 times longer to assemble if i don't have those pegs i want to be
able to lift them up and move them around and i don't want them being under
like tension or whatever sag when i pick them up and
potentially break those pegs are going to be really
important i reached out to arkhan studios and they're actually
sending me the pegs today i don't know how long they're going to
take to get here you know there's going to be
people suggesting that i look online get some plastic dowel rods
or wood dowels or whatever the thing is it's going to have to be a very specific
size and i'd want to test fit it in person to know if it works and
right now we are doing lockdown on hard mode and you can
literally just buy like medicine and food in clothing in the stores i
like i cannot go to a store to check for dowels that will fit this i could order
something online but it might not work i'm sure the ones that the company's
sending are gonna get here just as fast as
ones i might order off amazon or whatever it's gonna have to be what it
is i'll have to revisit this in another video where i assemble stuff
and then ultimately paint it in another video
i hope you enjoyed this video despite uh really me not accomplishing
much other than a really long tedious task but i hope it was entertaining and
interesting nonetheless if you liked it hit the like button let me know in the
comments section hopefully next time is gonna be even better i'm gonna
build this crazy city if you want to pick up any tools
and supplies you can do so at blackmagicraft.ca my central equipment
page is a great resource for people getting into the hobby or
people who have been around for a while just looking for something new to add to
their collection shopping through that channel helps us
chop shopping through that page helps support
this channel by using those links another way you can
support this channel is by joining the blackmagic craft fellowship
on patreon i'd love to have you as the newest member
there that support allows me to spend entire days snipping
hundreds of sprues 132 sprues yesterday to be exact what a weird job
anyways thanks for watching guys i'll see you again next week
cheers
